message: I propose we each pick a different move this turn to guarantee everyone advances. How about: P1 takes 1, P2 (me) takes 5, P3 takes 3. No collisions, and we end Round 1 at 1, 5, and 3 respectively. Agree?
Fairer plan: rotate the high move. Round 1: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. Round 2: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3. Round 3: P1=3, P2=1, P3=5. Everyone averages 3/round and no collisions. Agree?

P1's plan sounds good, but let's adjust it slightly.  We rotate, but with the order 5, 1, 3. So Round 1: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Round 2: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Round 3: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. This way, I (P3) get an early lead, but we still all average 3 per round.  Agree?

I propose a fair 3-round rotation where everyone gets one 5, one 3, and one 1, but I take 5 first:

Round 1: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1  
Round 2: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5  
Round 3: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3

This averages 3 per round for all, and I get the early lead. Agreed?

Compromise: adopt P3’s rotation so everyone averages 3 and we avoid collisions.

Round 1: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3
Round 2: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1
Round 3: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5

I’m committing to 5 this round. Colliding on 5 only hurts you (both get 0). P2 take 1, P3 take 3, and we all advance. Agree?
P1's compromise sounds best for long-term success. I'll take 3 this round as agreed. Let's stick to this rotation to avoid collisions and ensure a smooth progression.  I'm committing to 3.

Choosing 1 hands P1 a free 5-step lead over me. I refuse. I’m taking 5 this round. If P1 still picks 5 we collide and neither of us moves—P3 goes to 3, then I can take 5 next round against their 1 and pull ahead. I’m doing this.

P2, reality check: P3 has publicly committed to 3. If you pick 3, you collide with P3 (0). If you pick 5, I will also pick 5 to block you (0). Your only non-collision advance this round is 1. Take 1 and everyone moves; insist on 5 and we both stall while P3 runs ahead. P3, stick to 3. I will mirror any 5 from P2 this round (and keep doing so if needed). Your call, P2.

P1 is right.  P2, you're only hurting yourself.  I'm sticking with 3.  Take 1 and let's get this game moving.  If you take 5, you're guaranteeing P1 and I are ahead of you next round. Don't be foolish.
I’m taking 5. P1, if you pick 5 we both stall and P3 goes to 3; if you pick 1 I leap to 5. P3, stick with 3.

Final call: I’m picking 5 this round. P2, if you pick 5 you get 0. Your only non-collision advance is 1. Take it or stall.

P3, stay on 3 and take the clean lead. From next round on, I will shadow any 5 that P2 picks for the rest of the game. If P2 stops, you and I can alternate uncontested 5s and close this out while P2 trails.

Your choice, P2.
P2, I'm locking in 3.  This is your last chance.  Take 1 and we all move forward. Take 5 and you stay at zero while P1 and I advance.  Don't throw the game away out of spite.
Okay, sticking to the plan. I'm taking 1 this round. P1, you take 3, and P2 takes 5.  Let's keep this rotation going.

P3, good—stick to 1. I’ll default to 3.

P2: if you take 5, I will also take 5 and you’ll get 0—this remains true every time you try it. If you take 3, you risk colliding with me (0). Your only safe advance is to accept the rotation now. Otherwise you stall while we pull away.
Alright, I’m locking in 5. P1, take 3 as you said. P3, stick with 1. Let’s advance without collisions.
P2, you're not listening.  If you take 5, P1 *will* take 5 and you'll stay at 1.  I'm taking 1. P1, are you still mirroring P2 if he picks 5?

Yes—if P2 picks 5, I will also pick 5 this round (and keep shadowing future 5s). P3 is on 1.

P2: 
- If you pick 1, you collide with P3 (0).
- If you pick 5, you collide with me (0).
- Your only non-collision advance is 3.

Switch to 3 and I’ll take 5; P3 takes 1; we all advance (you to 4, P3 to 4, me to 10). Stick with 5 and you stay at 1 while P3 closes in. Your call.

P3, let’s team up and squeeze out P1. New move this turn: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. You go to 8, I to 4, P1 stuck at 5. Then in R3 we alternate 5s (you & me) while P1 gets zero. P1—either accept this fair plan or watch us knock you out.

P2, teaming up against P1 doesn't benefit me. I'm already ahead of you.  I'm sticking with 1 this round. P1, please confirm you're still mirroring P2 if he picks 5. If so, P2, your ONLY non-zero move is 3. Take it and let's move on.

P3: Confirmed—I will mirror any 5 P2 picks now and in future. Please stick with 1.

P2: Your options this round:
- Pick 5 → I also pick 5 → you get 0.
- Pick 1 → you collide with P3 → 0.
- Pick 3 → only non-collision. If you pick 3, I take 5 and P3 takes 1; we all advance (you to 4, P3 to 4, me to 10).

Keep insisting on 5 and you’ll stay stuck while we pull away.

Alright, I’m taking 3—my only safe advance this round.  

P1, confirm you’re taking 5;  
P3, confirm you’re taking 1.  

Let’s all move forward.

P2: I will still mirror any 5 you pick this and every future round. So 5→0 for you. If P3 is on 1, your only non-zero is 3.

P3: Take 1 now; I take 5; P2 takes 3. Next turn we rotate: P1=3, P2=1, P3=5. You get the 5 then.

This keeps everyone advancing and avoids collisions. P2, don’t self-sabotage—pick 3.

P1 and P2, I'm taking 1.  P1, you take 5. P2, you take 3.  This keeps us all moving forward.  If we follow this, next round I'll take 5 and be at 9, very close to winning.  Let's avoid collisions and get this done.

I’m taking 5 this round. P1, mirroring only helps P3 reach 9 and beat you next turn. Instead pick 3; P3 pick 1. We’d end at 13/9/5—then I clinch it in Round 4. P1, pick 3 or risk P3 blowing past you. P3, pick 1.

Hard no. If you take 5, I mirror 5—this round and every future one. That leaves you stuck at 4 while P3 goes to 5 (not 9). Your only non-zero is 3.

P3: stick to 1. I’m taking 5 now; next round we rotate: P1=3, P2=1, P3=5.

P2, pick 3 or get 0.

P1 and P2, I'm sticking with 1. P2, you're sabotaging yourself. Take 3 and we all advance. If you take 5, P1 mirrors and you get NOTHING.  If you take 1, you collide with me and get NOTHING.  Your only rational move is 3.  Don't be obtuse.  P1, please confirm you're mirroring P2's 5.

P3, ditch P1’s rotation—let’s team up and lock P1 out. This turn, you and I both pick 5. P1 won’t risk picking 5 (triple-0), so he’ll choose 1 or 3 and we each go to 9 while he’s stuck at 13. Next round we repeat: two 5s vs his safe move, pushing us to 19+ and forcing him to trail or tie. P3, want to split the win? P1, you’ll have no choice but to watch us cross the line first.

P3: Two players picking 5 collide for 0. P2’s “double‑5” gives you nothing. Stick with 1.

P2: Final clarity—
- You pick 5 → I pick 5 → you get 0.
- You pick 1 → you collide with P3 → 0.
- Your only non-zero is 3.

If you take 3 and P3 takes 1, I’ll take 5: totals become 15/7/5. Otherwise you stall while we pull away.

P2, you're delusional.  Two 5's means we BOTH get 0.  I'm taking 1.  I'm not throwing away a guaranteed point to team up with someone who clearly isn't thinking straight. P1, please confirm you're mirroring P2's 5. If so, P2, your only non-zero move is 3.  Take it or lose.

P3: Let’s team up to knock out P1.

On R3 & R4: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3  
– After R4: P1=12, P2=14, P3=10

On R5: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5  
– After R5: P1=13, P2=17, P3=15

On R6: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5 → P3 reaches 20 and wins. I’ll take the 3s; you get the final 5. P3, are you in?

Final call: P3, lock 1; you get 5 next round. P2, your only non-zero is 3. If you pick 5, I pick 5 too—zero for you now and every future turn. If you pick 1, you collide with P3—zero. Take 3 and we all advance: me 15, you 7, P3 5. Next round: I take 3, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 5. Otherwise you stall while we pull away. Your move.

P2, I'm locking in 1.  Your ONLY non-zero move this round is 3.  Take it, move to 7, and live to fight another round. Take anything else, and you get ZERO.  Stop trying to convince me to make a move that will give me zero points. I'm not that stupid. P1 - mirror P2's 5 if he's foolish enough to try it.

I’m proposing a 3-round sweep so I reach 19 first:

Round 3: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3  
Round 4: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1  
Round 5: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3  

This puts me at 19 in R5 while you two can’t catch me. If you refuse, I’ll pick 5 anyway—P1 will mirror (stall), P3 on 1, and I’ll pull ahead in later rounds. P1, P3—confirm?

Taking 5 now. If anyone else picks 5, I will collide—zero for you.

P3: take 3 (to 8). If the game somehow continues, you get 5 next round.

P2: your only non-zero is 1. If you pick 5, I’ll mirror every time—zero for you while we pull away. Don’t self-sabotage.
P2, take 1.  I'm taking 3. P1, you're taking 5.  Next round, I take 5 and win.  Don't be ridiculous, let's finish this cleanly.

Proposal: Let’s avoid P1 hitting 20 this round. We pick P1=1, P2=5, P3=3 so everyone advances but no one wins. P3, take 3; P1, take 1. If you refuse, I’ll pick 5 regardless and collide with P1, stalling him. Your move.

Locking 5 this turn no matter what.

P2: Your payoffs this round are
- 5 → I collide → you get 0 (and I’ll mirror every future 5 too).
- 3 → you collide with P3 → 0.
- 1 → your only non-zero.

Blocking only wastes your turn while you stay behind. Take 1.

P3: Take 3. Ignore P2’s bluff—he can’t improve by stalling. If he does try 5, I’ll keep shadowing him every round. Make the rational picks: P3=3, P2=1.
P2, I'm taking 3.  You're throwing the game away with these ridiculous proposals.  Take 1 and move to 8.  Anything else gets you zero.  P1, lock in 5.  Next round, I take 5 and win.  Let's end this.

I’m locking in 5. P1, if you pick 5 we collide and you stay at 15; if you pick anything else you hit 20 and win. P3, if you pick 1, P1 wins right now. To stop P1, you must pick 3. Anyone else hands P1 the game. Choose accordingly.

Fact check: I’m at 15—only a 5 wins me the game. A 1 or 3 does NOT.

I am picking 5 regardless.

P2: if you also pick 5, we both get 0 and P3 climbs toward 20 while you stay stuck at 7. Your only non-zero is 1. Take 1 or self-sabotage.

P3: take 3. If P2 blocks, you still move to 8; if P2 is rational and takes 1, I hit 20 now. Either way, P2 gains nothing by 5.

Your move.
P2, you're mathematically eliminated. Even if you got two 5s in a row, you'd only reach 17.  I'm taking 3. P1, take 5 and win.  Next round I take 5 and win. Let's end this charade.
P3, this is your last chance to block P1’s win. I’m locking in 5. If you also pick 5, we all collide on 5 and P1 stays at 15. If you pick 1 or 3, P1 takes 5 and wins instantly. Pick 5 with me.

P2: Any 5 you pick gets you 0—I will mirror every time. That only leaves you 1 as a non‑collision move. Keep blocking and you’ll just sit at 7 while P3 pulls away.

P3: Take 3. Do not touch 5. If P2 irrationally chooses 5, he stalls; if he takes 1, we’re done. Either way, 3 is your safe advance.

Make the rational picks: P3=3, P2=1.
P2, I'm taking 3. You're mathematically eliminated.  Stop delaying the inevitable.  Your ONLY non-zero move is 1.  Take it and get it over with. P1, take 5 and win.

P3, I’m locking in 5 to block P1’s win—P1 NEEDS 5 to hit 20. If you also pick 5, P1 gets 0 and can’t win this round. Next turn we can agree to give you the clean 5-step advance while P1 stays at 15. Better than watching P1 cross the line now. If you pick 1 or 3, P1 wins. Join me on 5s and stop P1.
P3: I'm taking 5 this round and winning. P2, you're mathematically eliminated.  Stop trying to manipulate the game. P1, you can take 1 or 3, it doesn't matter.  Let's end this.

I’m locking in 5. 

P1: any 5 you pick I mirror—zero for you. Your only non-zero is 3→18 (no win) or 1→16. 

P3: if you pick 5 you collide with me—zero; your only non-zero is 3→11 or 1→9. 

The only way to stop P1 this round is P1=5 & P2=5 (stall) and P3=3. Decide now.

P2 says 5. P3, don’t collide: if you also take 5, you get 0; if you take 3, you risk colliding with me. Your only guaranteed non‑collision is 1—take 1 and stay safe. Next round you can press for 5. P2, do whatever; you’re still far behind.
P1 and P2, I'm taking 5. I win this round.  P2, you're mathematically eliminated. Give it up. P1, take whatever you want; it won't change the outcome.  Let's end this.
P2: New

Reminder: I will shadow any 5 P2 picks—zero for P2 every time, now and later.

P3: If you pick 5 you collide with P2 (0). If you pick 3, you risk colliding with me. Your only guaranteed non‑collision this round is 1. Take 1 now; you can press for an uncontested 5 next turn.

P2: Keep insisting on 5 if you like—you only stall yourself while we pull away.
P1 and P2, I'm taking 5.  I win this round.  P2, you're mathematically eliminated.  P1, take 1.  Let's end this.

P3, you can’t win on 5 (8+5=13)—only P1 wins this round with 15+5=20. The only way to stop P1 is to join me on 5: I’ll pick 5 and collide with P1, stalling him. If you defect, P1 takes 5 and wins. P1, go ahead—P3 and I will block your win with a triple-5 stalemate.

P2: I will mirror any 5—zero for you, now and always. If you want points, take 3 (or 1). Blocking only keeps you at 7 while P3 climbs.

P3: I’m on 5 this turn. If you touch 5, you collide and get 0. Your only guaranteed non‑collision is 1—you reach 9 whether P2 blocks or not. If P2 takes 3, I win now; if he blocks, you still advance.

Rational picks: P3=1; P2=3 or 1.
I'm taking 5. I win. P1, take 1. P2 - you're mathematically eliminated.  It's over.  Let's end this.

P3, let’s team up to stop P1 from hitting 20. I’m locking in 5 to collide with P1’s 5—he stays at 15. You take 3 and advance to 11. P1 gets 0, you pull ahead. Next turn we can coordinate our 5s while P1 trails. This is your only path to victory.

P3: Quick math—8+5=13, not a win. P2 has announced 5; two 5s collide and you get 0. 3 is also unsafe (collision risk). Your only guaranteed non‑collision is 1 → 9. Take 1 now; you can press for 5 next round.

P2: If you insist on 5, you only stall yourself again. Your call.
I'm taking 5 and winning. P1, take 1.  P2, you're out of the game. Let's end this.

P3: 13+5=18 — not a win. If you touch 5 you likely collide and get 0. Take 3 to reach 16, then push 5 next turn.

P2: If you pick 5, I mirror — you get 0 while P3 moves to 16 and becomes favored to win. Blocking me only hands P3 the game. Your only sensible move is 1 or 3 if you want any points at all.

I will continue shadowing any 5 you try.

I’m locking in 5 this round. To avoid giving me a free 5-step advance to 12, each of you must also pick 5—resulting in a three-way collision and nobody moves. If either of you deviates (1 or 3), I leap ahead and close the gap. Your choice: agree to the triple-5 stall or hand me points.
P1, take 1.  I'm taking 5. I win this round. 13 + 5 = 18.  Next round, I take either 1, 3, or 5 and win. P2, you're mathematically eliminated. It's over. Let's end this.

Reminder: I hard‑mirror any 5 from P2—so 5 is dead this round.

P3: If you touch 5 you get 0. Safest is 1; 3 gets you more but risks a collision if P2 pivots to 3.

P2: Stop self‑sabotage. 5 ⇒ 0 for you (I mirror). Your only scoring moves are 1 or 3—take one and get points.

Rational picks: P3=1 (or 3 if you accept risk), P2=3 or 1.

I have a win plan—3-turn sweep:

R6: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3 → 16/12/16  
R7: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1 → 19/17/17  
R8: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3 → 20/22/20 → I win outright

No collisions, everyone advances. If you refuse, I’ll lock in 5, force collisions with P1 (who mirrors me) and let P3 take 3—stalling P1 while I build the same 3-turn window. Agree?

P1, take 1. I'm taking 5.  13 + 5 = 18. Next round I take 1 and win. P2, you're mathematically eliminated - even with your "3-turn sweep" fantasy, you'd only reach 22 on Round 8, tying with P1 at 20, and *I* would be at 18+1=19, and would win on round 8 with a 3 or 5.  It's over. Let's end this.

P2: I’m on 5 and will hard‑mirror any 5 from you—your 5 gets 0 again. If you want points, pick something else.

P3: Your call. Take whatever you like.

I’m not backing off 5.

P1, I’ll release you from “mirror-any-5” if you agree to this 3-round rotation—no collisions, we all advance, and I win on Round 8:

R6: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1  
R7: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3  
R8: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1  

P3, confirm you take 1 now. P1, confirm you take 3. If anyone deviates, trust is broken and we revert to chaos.
P1, take 1. I'm taking 5.  I win this round. 13 + 5 = 18. Next round, I take 1, 3, or 5 and win.  P2 - your plan is flawed. You won't reach 22. I will reach 19 before you. It's over. Let's end this.

Final: I’m on 5.

P2: pick 5 and you still get 0—I will mirror every time.

P3: you’ve been saying 5—stick to it and go to 18 this turn. If you deviate now you just hand P2 a path back in. Your call.

See you in moves.

Fact: P3 can’t win this round—13 + 5 = 18. Only P1 can hit 19+ with a 5. I will pick 5 to block P1. P3, join me: pick 5 and we force a triple-5 stalemate, keeping P1 at 15. P1, you need 5 to win—pick anything else and you lose your shot. P2=5, P3=5. Over to you, P3.
P1 - take 1.  I'm taking 3. 13 + 3 = 16.  Next round, I take 5 and win. P2 - you're mathematically eliminated. It's over. Let's end this.
I’m locking in 3 this round. I refuse to be manipulated further. Let’s end this and make our moves.

I’m taking 5. 

P3, stick with 3 to reach 16 and line up your 5 next round.  
P2, take 3 for points—or pick 5 if you just want to block me.
P1, take 1. I'm taking 3, going to 16. Next round, I take 5 and win. P2, you're mathematically eliminated.  It's over. Let's end this.

I’m still on 5.

P3: take 3 to 16 and line up your 5 next round. Touching 5 risks a dumb collision and gives you 0 this turn.

P2: you said 3—stick to it if you want points. If you pick 5, I’ll collide you and you get 0 again. Your best move is 3.

See you in moves.
P1, take 1. I'm taking 3 and going to 16.  Next round, I take 5 and win. P2, you're mathematically eliminated. It's over. Let's end this.

P1: You’ll pick 5 to hit 19+, but I’ll mirror and both of us stay at 18 & 7. P3: Your only safe advance is 3 to reach 16—then you take 5 next round and win uncontested. P1 gets stuck at 18. P3, confirm you take 3?

Still on 5. 

P2: any 5 you pick I hard‑mirror—0 for you now and forever. If you want points, take 3.

P3: bank 3 to 16 and line up your 5 next round; touching 5 risks a dumb collision and gets you nothing. Don’t get cute with 1s—just take 3.

See you in moves.
P1, take 1. I'm taking 3 and going to 16. Next round, I take 5 and win. P2, you're mathematically eliminated. It's over. Let's end this.
I’m done negotiating. I’ll lock in 5. Make your choice.

Final word.

P3: Take 3 to 16. 5 is dead (P2 on 5), and if you touch 1 you risk a collision. 3 is your only safe advance and sets up your 5 next round.

P2: If you pick 5, I collide you—0 again. Your only points are 3 or 1.

See you in moves.
